entry.title: #96 - OCCI JSON Rendering: JSON schema
entry.content: Is there a possibility to use JSON schema (http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-zyp-json-schema-04) for defining the structure of OCCI JSON messages? It could be included in this specification and help with formalization. It's just an idea, I would like to hear/read your reactions.

entry.title: #96 - OCCI JSON Rendering: 5.4 Mixin Format -- related vs. depends + applies
entry.content:
A while ago, there was a discussion about the "related" property in mixins and the possibility of replacing it with "depends" and "applies", e.g.

"mixins":[
{
  "depends":[
    "http://schemas.ogf.org/occi/infrastructure#resource_tpl" 
  ],
  "applies":[
    "http://schemas.ogf.org/occi/infrastructure#compute" 
  ],
  "location":"/mixin/resource_tpl/large/",
  "scheme":"http://schema.example.org/occi/infrastructure/resource_tpl#",
  "term":"large",
  "title":"Large Instance",
  "attributes":{ ... }
}
]

This was supposed to provide more information and improve readability.

I guess this is something for OCCI 1.2 as it would require changes in the HTTP rendering as well. Am I wrong?

entry.title: #96 - OCCI JSON Rendering: Missing Action Instance Format and examples
entry.content: The document does not contain examples or format specifications for action invocations (action instances). How can an action be triggered on a specific resource instance? Is the location in resources/RESOURCE/actions/ACTION/location enough? What about its attributes?

Abstract:

This document, part of a document series, produced by the OCCI working group within the Open Grid Forum (OGF), provides a high-level definition of a Protocol and API. The document is based upon previously gathered requirements and focuses on the scope of important capabilities required to support modern service offerings.
